data.title: ServerException when attempting to delete a submission multiple times
data.content:
This is partly user error for trying to delete a submission multiple times, but is inconsistent between submission and comment DELETE behaviour. 

When I DELETE a submission using api/v1/submissions/{submissionID} I get a "success": true response the first two times I do this, but from then on I get
    "success": false,
    "error": {
        "type": "ServerException",
        "message": "An exception has been encountered."
    }

This is different from the Comments DELETE API, where I can run with the same commentID over and over and still get "success": true
data.formattedContent:
This is partly user error for trying to delete a submission multiple times, but is inconsistent between submission and comment DELETE behaviour.

When I DELETE a submission using api/v1/submissions/{submissionID} I get a "success": true response the first two times I do this, but from then on I get "success": false, "error": { "type": "ServerException", "message": "An exception has been encountered." }

This is different from the Comments DELETE API, where I can run with the same commentID over and over and still get "success": true

data.title: Status/Timeline with API
data.content:
We are working on modifying code in our main Voat branch to accommodate the addition API. 

The API was originally designed to run alongside the website but now we know this is impossible to accomplish with our traffic at Voat. This means we have to pull out a lot of code, that has a lot of interdependencies, and move it into .DLLs so it can be consumed equally by the UI and API.

We will do this in two phases:

1. Refactor/Relocate code in UI. Deploy and verify that site is operational. 
2. Modify API backend to consume this new organization.
3. Rectify cache logic with API functionality
4. Build into API all bug fixes, lack of functionality issues. 
5. Deploy API to test site & verify with App builders 
6. Deploy API to production

I will update this thread with info on each phase completed as it is completed. Right now we are working on Step 1.

From the bottom of my heart, I apologize for this long delay. I know so many have been working so hard and it bothers me knowing I'm the hold up.

I will talk to @Atko about getting everyone here (who has tested the API) a special badge on RealVoat. What should this badge be called? The long run? The Never Ending API? Patience young Jedi? FakeVout > RealVoat?

~PuttPutt (damn you moe and dan)
data.formattedContent:
We are working on modifying code in our main Voat branch to accommodate the addition API.

The API was originally designed to run alongside the website but now we know this is impossible to accomplish with our traffic at Voat. This means we have to pull out a lot of code, that has a lot of interdependencies, and move it into .DLLs so it can be consumed equally by the UI and API.

We will do this in two phases:

  1. Refactor/Relocate code in UI. Deploy and verify that site is operational.
  2. Modify API backend to consume this new organization.
  3. Rectify cache logic with API functionality
  4. Build into API all bug fixes, lack of functionality issues.
  5. Deploy API to test site & verify with App builders
  6. Deploy API to production

I will update this thread with info on each phase completed as it is completed. Right now we are working on Step 1.

From the bottom of my heart, I apologize for this long delay. I know so many have been working so hard and it bothers me knowing I'm the hold up.

I will talk to @Atko about getting everyone here (who has tested the API) a special badge on RealVoat. What should this badge be called? The long run? The Never Ending API? Patience young Jedi? FakeVout > RealVoat?

~PuttPutt (damn you moe and dan)

data.title: Issues with private messaging
data.content:
Whenever I try and reply to a private message, I just get the error:

**Type: ServerException**

**Message: An exception has been encountered**

Also, when I get api/v1/u/messages/Inbox/All the response is the same as api/v1/u/messages/Sent/All and new sent messages do not appear until the other person marks them as read.
data.formattedContent:
Whenever I try and reply to a private message, I just get the error:

Type: ServerException

Message: An exception has been encountered

Also, when I get api/v1/u/messages/Inbox/All the response is the same as api/v1/u/messages/Sent/All and new sent messages do not appear until the other person marks them as read.

data.title: [Bug] Sending empty content field in submission POST returns error.
data.content:
When making the following POST request: `{"title":"asdasdasd","content":""}` it returns `{"success":false,"error":{"type":"Validation","message":"Either a Url or Content must be provided."}}`. What it should do is make a post with just a title and no content. I believe this is a bug because when I POST `{"title":"asdasdasd","content":" "}` (with a space for the content value) it works and leaves the content empty.

As usual, thanks for all the work and hope this gets resolved.
data.formattedContent:
When making the following POST request: {"title":"asdasdasd","content":""} it returns {"success":false,"error":{"type":"Validation","message":"Either a Url or Content must be provided."}}. What it should do is make a post with just a title and no content. I believe this is a bug because when I POST {"title":"asdasdasd","content":" "} (with a space for the content value) it works and leaves the content empty.

As usual, thanks for all the work and hope this gets resolved.

data.title: Get it while it's hot!
data.content:
FakeVout is currently exceeding its data quota at an alarming rate, because of this the site automatically shuts off until the cap resets.

We will move this site to another location that won't have this issue but as you may know, this is the least of our concerns right now.

Apologies and will get fixed soon.

#Edit: FakeVout is now hosted on a different account and should have no data/cpu caps in place.
data.formattedContent:
FakeVout is currently exceeding its data quota at an alarming rate, because of this the site automatically shuts off until the cap resets.

We will move this site to another location that won't have this issue but as you may know, this is the least of our concerns right now.

Apologies and will get fixed soon.

Edit: FakeVout is now hosted on a different account and should have no data/cpu caps in place.

data.title: API Beg Thread
data.content:
<Suit type="flame retardant">

Just wondering if we have a timeframe for the new API being available in some capacity on RealVoat<sup>TM</sup>?

I have a working bot implementation on both websites, but the method I'm forced to use on the other site without an API has to be babied every time it runs. An API would allow me to host it cheap and reliably on Azure as well as give others access to it (there is demand trust me).

</Suit>
data.formattedContent:
<Suit type="flame retardant">

Just wondering if we have a timeframe for the new API being available in some capacity on RealVoatTM?

I have a working bot implementation on both websites, but the method I'm forced to use on the other site without an API has to be babied every time it runs. An API would allow me to host it cheap and reliably on Azure as well as give others access to it (there is demand trust me).

</Suit>

data.title: Search Options : Page option seems to be off by one, multiplied.
data.content:
Not sure if this bug has been brought up before but it looks like there is an off by one bug mixed in with the multiplication. For example if I say count = 5, page = 2, it actually shows me submissions 7-12, instead of 6-11. If I enter count = 5, page = 3, it looks like its off by 2.

So I can only assume that using count = 5, page = 4 will be off by 3. I can test in more detail but I think this is enough information to look into it. I'll just use index's for now.



Thanks
data.formattedContent:
Not sure if this bug has been brought up before but it looks like there is an off by one bug mixed in with the multiplication. For example if I say count = 5, page = 2, it actually shows me submissions 7-12, instead of 6-11. If I enter count = 5, page = 3, it looks like its off by 2.

So I can only assume that using count = 5, page = 4 will be off by 3. I can test in more detail but I think this is enough information to look into it. I'll just use index's for now.

Thanks
